text: Honestly I wanted a break from being accountable for everyone. It took me sometime to figure out what exactly or how exactly I can do that. I knew I wanted to do creative work like writing, editing, designing and work on my small idea projects. In order to do that I had to step down. There wasnt any specific miment but i had lot of clarity on what i want to do and how. The rest happened one after the other. I guess it took me sometime to realize that i can always opt to do what i want and it is going to be my call always.

text: I feel exactly the same about being accountable for everyone <@U014QJ54630>. I stepped back from a role that included a fair amount of micromanaging people's work and output after having tried it for three months. Made me completely miserable. We're currently in the process of restructuring and I'll be taking a management role again but people are supposed to be working a lot more independently now and are accountable for their own results. So I hope this will work better for me because, same as <@UUJBXGZMZ> I really enjoy the strategic part of the role.

elements.text: I feel exactly the same about being accountable for everyone

So I hope this will work better for me because, same as
I really enjoy the strategic part of the role.

text: You’re right. When people start taking ownership of their own work it becomes easier to lead as well. I am glad you guys are having a restructuring.

elements.text: You’re right. When people start taking ownership of their own work it becomes easier to lead as well. I am glad you guys are having a restructuring.

text: i really appreciate this conversation! thank you for the follow-up <@U014QJ54630> and for sharing your experience and perspective <@UUJBTMPSP>. so much of what you're both sharing is relevant to what i'm thinking through—it's so helpful to think it through with others who really get it! i am increasingly feeling like i'd like to find a way to lead and collaborate less, and do more solo creative work—without giving up my strategy responsibilities. what i realize is that i love both my creative and strategic work; what i _don't_ love is the leading and managing and near-constant interaction with others that is part of my role at present. i'm of course flexible about how i operate—i want to be as helpful as i can be to my team—but i'd like to flex in the right direction. :slightly_smiling_face: thank you all so much for your insights! :pray::skin-tone-2:

thank you all so much for your insights!

text: :two_hearts: glad my experience and perspective helped.
